> I do not know any sword clubs in Arizona.

hat my interest in Nihonto was kindled when
traveling through the Phoenix a=
irport and waiting for my flight, I
observed a exhibition of about two or t=
hree small kiosks displaying a
total of maybe twenty or so swords.  I remem=
ber thinking that I had
vaguely read or heard of the involved metallurgy in=
 Japanese swords,
but, upon seeing the real McCoy for the first time, then =
thinking,
"Wow!  I had no idea.  These things are really neat!"  A wet mack=
erel
to the side of the head, for sure.  I've oft wondered who or what
orga=
nization put on that display.  It was sometime in the later '80s,

 I wonder who I should thank, or blame, for source
